result.execSummary:
The defendant Lamareo T Howell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Submit DNA sample if not already done.
Pay all costs, surcharges, mandatory DNA surcharge.  To be paid from out of up to 25% prison wages. Any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

Deendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving one half (1/2) Initial Confinement.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other senttence.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain full time employment.

No illegal drugs.
No controled substances without valid prescription.
No contact with drug community.
Alcohol and drug assessment. Comply with any treatment deemedn ecessary by the department. Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.  No positive results.

supervisions.notes: Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons.  Civil rights suspended until reinstated.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lamareo T Howell

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Order Concerning Setence Adjustment signed and filed. tk 
The petition for sentence adjustment is denied because it is not in the public interest.
Copies mailed to parties.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to Carolina Stark, Branch 17, for review. crt
as to count one, with VTS, conduct listings, letter, supporting documents.

Defendant Lamareo T Howell in court with attorney Anne A Devitt.  Paul M Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.    Sentencing proceeded.    Statements made by counsel and defendant.  


The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 33 months, consecutive to any other sentence.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 15 months with credit for 6 days time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 18 months.
Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by the Dept. of Corrections, but to include:
*
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he/she may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge, out of up to 25% prison wages, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
- Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 1/2 initial confinement.
- Received and filed:  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Violation report received and filed with court.

Defendant Lamareo T Howell in court with attorney Anne A Devitt.  Danielle E Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Court in jury trial this date; case rescheduled.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 06-26-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Lamareo T Howell in court with attorney Anne A Devitt.  Danielle E Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin (for ADA Hauer).
  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 06-04-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Lamareo T Howell in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Hanna R. Kolberg appeared for Paul Hauer for the State of Wisconsin. Case adjourned for a Projected Guilty Plea and Sentencing in Branch 26.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 22, 2014 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Lamareo T Howell in court with attorney Anne A Devitt.  Paul M Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Scheduling conference scheduled for 04-07-2014 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.

Defendant Lamareo T Howell in court with attorney Anne A Devitt.  Defendant Lamareo T Howell in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge POCAN, Branch 26.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 26, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
